definition: to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: And when Owl hooted , Bluebird could not sleep.
sentences.chinese: 當貓頭鷹叫的時候，知更鳥睡不着。

sentences.english: From its nest the bird flew down and fanned the embers with its wings.
sentences.chinese: 知更鳥從它的巢中飛下來，用它的翅膀扇着火的灰燼。

sentences.english: Millions of high school students have read "To Kill a Mockingbird".
sentences.chinese: 已有數百萬高中生讀過《殺死一隻知更鳥》。

sentences.english: If this was a, a robin or some other bird, songbird, the bill would be held roughly horizontally like that.
sentences.chinese: 換成是知更鳥或鳴鳥的話，鳥喙就是水平舉起的。

sentences.english: Robins were sprinkling the evening air with flute-like whistles.
sentences.chinese: 知更鳥用長笛般的鳴聲潑濺着晚間的空氣。

sentences.english: A hungry little robin hopped onto the windowsill.
sentences.chinese: 一隻飢餓的小知更鳥跳到窗臺上。

sentences.english: The robins occupied their former nest.
sentences.chinese: 那些知更鳥佔了它們的老窩。

sentences.english: One of these birds is the robin.
sentences.chinese: 有一種鳥叫紅襟知更鳥。

sentences.english: bluebird in the garden, a spirit in a house, a kind man on the side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 花圃中的藍知更鳥，衡宇中的精靈，路邊的大好人。

sentences.english: A bluebird in the garden, a spirit in a house, a kind man on the side of the road.
sentences.chinese: 花園中的藍知更鳥，房屋中的精靈，路邊的好人。

sentences.english: People often confuse robins with nightingales.
sentences.chinese: 人們常常把夜鶯跟知更鳥搞混。

sentences.english: And starlings actually appear to be innocent in the case of the missing bluebirds.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，藍知更鳥的數量減少和椋鳥並沒有關係。

sentences.english: An adult robin can grow to be 10 inches long.
sentences.chinese: 一隻成年紅襟知更鳥可以長到10英寸長。

sentences.english: And with the inchworm, he flew to where other birds needed to be measured.
sentences.chinese: 知更鳥帶著尺蠖飛到其他鳥需要被測量的地方。

sentences.english: A mockingbird is a kind of gray songbird.
sentences.chinese: 知更鳥是一種灰白色的會唱歌的鳥。

sentences.english: A tree may in summer wear a nest of robins in her hair.
sentences.chinese: 一棵樹到了夏天，可能在其枝葉中藏著一窩的知更鳥。

definition: Six Records of a Floating Life, autobiographical novel and description of Qing dynasty life by 沈復|沈复[Shen3 Fu4], published 1808
Klein or Kline (name)/Felix Klein (1849-1925), German mathematician
Das Kapital (1867) by Karl Marx 卡爾·馬克思|卡尔·马克思[Ka3 er3 · Ma3 ke4 si1]
Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀
La Comédie humaine, series of novels by 19th century French novelist Honoré de Balzac 巴爾扎克|巴尔扎克[Ba1 er3 zha1 ke4]
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
Romeo and Juliet, 1594 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
pinyin: Luo2 mi4 ou1 yu3 Zhu1 li4 ye4

definition: Orwell (name)/George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984 一九八四年
